data.title: Measurement of the ${\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}}_{b}$ polarization and angular parameters in ${\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}}_{b}\ensuremath{\rightarrow}J/\ensuremath{\psi}\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lamb
data.meta_description: An analysis of the bottom baryon decay ${\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}}_{b}\ensuremath{\rightarrow}J/\ensuremath{\psi}(\ensuremath{\rightarrow}{\ensuremath{\mu}}^{+}{\ensuremath{\mu}}^{\ensuremath{-}})\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}(\ensuremath{\rightarrow}p{\ensuremath{\pi}}^{\ensuremath{-}})$ is performed to measure the ${\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}}_{b}$ polarization and three angular parameters in data from $pp$ collisions at $\sqrt{s}=7$ and 8 TeV, collected by the CMS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider. The ${\mathrm{\ensuremath{\Lambda}}}_{b}$ polarization is measured to be $0.00\ifmmode\pm\else\textpm\fi{}0.06(\mathrm{stat})\ifmmode\pm\else\textpm\fi{}0.06(\mathrm{syst})$ and the parity-violating asymmetry parameter is determined to be $0.14\ifmmode\pm\else\textpm\fi{}0.14(\mathrm{stat})\ifmmode\pm\else\textpm\fi{}0.10(\mathrm{syst})$. The measurements are compared to various theoretical predictions, including those from perturbative quantum chromodynamics.
